theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 Signaling Pathway Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on insulin/IGF-1 signaling modulation of longevity, conserved pathway regulating lifespan and insulin sensitivity effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 Signaling Pathway Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes IIS pathway as conserved regulator of lifespan with tissue-specific and neuroendocrine effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 Signaling Pathway Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details DAF-2/DAF-16 regulation of lifespan via insulin/IGF-1 signaling conserved across species.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 Signaling Pathway Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows reduced insulin signaling extends lifespan in Drosophila via dFOXO transcription factor.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 Signaling Pathway Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Integrates IIS and TOR nutrient sensing pathways regulating longevity via conserved transcriptional feedback.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 Signaling Pathway Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on FOXO/DAF-16 as central longevity regulator downstream of insulin/IGF-1 signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 Signaling Pathway Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links insulin/IGF-1 signaling defects to neurodegeneration and cognitive decline, emphasizing brain-specific effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 Signaling Pathway Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes genetic variation in IGF-1 pathway genes affecting plasma IGF-1 levels and human longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 Signaling Pathway Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details insulin receptor structure-function mutations affecting aging and reproduction in Drosophila.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 Signaling Pathway Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Summarizes evolutionary conservation and lifespan extension by reduced insulin/IGF-1 signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 Signaling Pathway Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on IIS regulation of lifespan and role of dFOXO and insulin-like peptides in Drosophila.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 Signaling Pathway Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes reduced IRS2 signaling branch of insulin/IGF-1 pathway linked to longevity and metabolic regulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 Signaling Pathway Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes conserved insulin/IGF-1 signaling pathway regulating aging via FOXO activation across species.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Insulin/IGF-1 Signaling Pathway Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details FKHRL1/DAF-16 transcription factor role in cell survival and lifespan extension, homologous to FOXO.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Extrinsic Mortality-Driven Resource Allocation Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on extrinsic mortality shaping resource allocation trade-offs between reproduction and maintenance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Extrinsic Mortality-Driven Resource Allocation Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Classic disposable soma theory emphasizing trade-off between reproduction and somatic maintenance shaped by ecology.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Extrinsic Mortality-Driven Resource Allocation Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Life-history trade-off between reproduction and longevity, including mating costs reducing lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Extrinsic Mortality-Driven Resource Allocation Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Resource reallocation hypothesis explaining lifespan extension by dietary restriction via reproduction-survival trade-off.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Extrinsic Mortality-Driven Resource Allocation Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Resource allocation model of diet-mediated lifespan plasticity emphasizing delayed reproduction and somatic maintenance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Extrinsic Mortality-Driven Resource Allocation Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Life-history trade-off theory highlighting energy allocation trade-offs between reproduction and somatic maintenance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Extrinsic Mortality-Driven Resource Allocation Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Disposable soma theory focusing on somatic maintenance trade-offs and germline immortality under ecological constraints.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Extrinsic Mortality-Driven Resource Allocation Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Reproductive adaptation hypothesis linking fertility schedules to survival characteristics and resource allocation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Reversal of Fecundity/Longevity Tradeoff in Social Insects Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes reversal of typical fecundity-longevity tradeoff in social insect queens with high reproduction and longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Germline Maintenance and Mutation Rate Trade-off Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on resource allocation trade-offs affecting germline DNA repair, mutation rates, and longevity under stress.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Germline Maintenance and Mutation Rate Trade-off Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Resource redistribution theory emphasizing trade-offs between housekeeping and integrative gene groups affecting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Germline Maintenance and Mutation Rate Trade-off Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: IGF-1 deficiency driving neurovascular aging, linking systemic hormone decline to cellular maintenance deficits.
